name: Environmental Station Alpha
description: Explore an abandoned space station in this retro-themed explorative action platformer.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3 CPU Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 310M DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 30 MB available space Sound Card: Realtek High Definition Audio Additional Notes: May vary from computer to computer

reviews.review_text: This is pretty much your best bet if you're searching for a metriodvania game on Steam as of this review... 9/10  Just a moment of your time, if I may: Steam is filled to BURSTING with absolute garbage! I've been through nearly 5000 games on my recomendations queue, and I've only been barely interested enough in 200 of them to put on my wishlist.  If you're like me, and completely jaded by misleading tags, lack of gameplay in trailers, early access games that have been abandoned, ( A flood of RPGMaker, visual novels, poorly drawn anime dating sim, choose your own destiny, point and click, simulation, 'survival horror', etc.) games that you are unable to filter out!!! (seriously steam, why the **** can't I filter this trash out?!)... Then your poor brain deserves this.  **Edit: Dear LORD of ALL that is HOLY and good in the universe, they've added a filter to the recommendations queue!! Thank you Lord Gaben!   The point is, this game is a deep breath of fresh air in an ocean of complete excrement.   +tight controls +FULL controller support, even allowing you to use the D-pad or the left thumb stick for movement. So I don't understand the 'Partial controller support' on the game's features. (And you bet your *** I'm using the XBox One Controller's D-Pad) +rewarding discoveries +brilliant and appropriate music +awesome boss battles +extended end game content  -there aren't enough talented people making games for Steam  Buy it at FULL price, because it's already being sold short!

Very clever level design and perfect difficulty will ensure that Environmental Station Alpha will keep all Metroidvania fans satisfied for many days.  + Smart level design + Long game length + Unique bosses + Challenging platforming + Multitude of upgrades + Great soundtrack  - Uninspired pixel art - Derivative overall feel - Little bit frustrating when stuck  8.5/10

Imagine cave story, the original one, or maybe cave story+. Now imagine it in space, with more mystery, and alittle less plot. That is Environmental Station Alpha. If you like Cave Story, or metroidvania's in general, and don't mind the difficulty, this game is perfect. I can not express how well the world is crafted. The amount of secrets, the amount of interesting areas and bosses, the very, very mysterious but intriguing plot. It's all you can ask for. Buy this game, you won't regret it. 10/10  update: ALSO THE END GAME. youre save file shows percentage completion to 100%. what the game doesn't tell you, is you can bring the save file to 200+% completion with hidden end game content. the puzzles are nuts. super fun.

The only game that deserves to be called: 'the rightful heir and spiritul successor of super metroid for SNES'.  This game feels like seeing your best friend from a long forgotten childhood but as soon as you start to see each other, it is like you've never been apart.  Thanks for making this game. It's such a joy to play !
Amazing game!! Addictive! If you loved the Metroid genre, or particularly SUPER METROID (which is one my fav games of all time!) you will love Environmental Station Alpha!!!

Are you hungry for a new Metroid game but sick of Nintendo sitting on their asses doing nothing? I've got great news, everyone; this game is fantastic and exactly what you're looking for. Great graphics that never seem repetitive or dull, nice atmospheric music setting the tone for each level, plenty of power-ups that aren't boring or derivative, level-progression that requires you to explore and never feels guided or linear, a bunch of challenging and fun bosses, and more than 10 hours of content for a blind playthrough.  Not only is it good to see the platformer/action-adventure genre get some love, but it's great to see such a charming and genuine example such as this game. Whether it's on sale or not, you wouldn't regret supporting this game.

Amazingly well put together Metroidvania, if you have any interest in this genre at all this game comes highly recommended!  Great soundtrack, art, sounds and gameplay, can't say one bad thing about the game, I've got plenty of hours on my save file and still haven't 100%'d the game.

Damn, this game is really, really good. It may have a dull name, but it has a ton of boss battles, and each one is unique, engaging, and incredibly satisfying. It's honestly one of the best games I've gotten off of Steam. It's fun as a completionist, but then there's also a bizarre metagame that goes beyond 100% if you want to take it further.  What I love about some of the indie metroidvania games is that they learn from a lot of the mistakes of the classics. This one does exactly that. The combat is fun, the puzzles are engaging, and the exploration is satisfying. Buy it! Play it! Right now!

People will surely make comparisons to metroid and rightly so, but it really is reminiscant of Todd's Adventures in Slime World for the Atari Lynx. All talk aside, this gae is fun if you are looking for a retro metroidvania experience. It's ot the biggest pixels you have ever seen
A VERY underated Metroidvania game that is very well designed and some pretty good boss battles and good exploration.
Absolutely wonderful, beautiful, and fun metroidvania game filled with secrets! Great music, awesome graphics, it's super finetuned and was just a joy to play! For only 8$ it's a steal!

If you had a great time playing Metroid games when you were young, this game is for you! The game is lovely and simple yet very challenging, especially when it comes to find the answers to the many riddles. I plunged into that game and enjoyed every single bit of it. I felt as nostalgic as I felt thrilled by this original new story.  There are much mysteries on which to ponder in the end. I hope this game will become a series, and I hope to learn much more on its lore.  I give it 9/10. One of my favorite indie game!

ESA is one of the best Metroid-inspired titles in recent memory. It has fantastic atmosphere, visuals, and music. It's a tough platforming and shooting challenge. It's tight, it's well-designed, and the world is alive and dynamic. There's also plenty of secrets to uncover. Don't be fooled by the low price tag. This is a meaty adventure with a lot of Super Metroid-esque fun to be had. Highly recommended.

Played it though nearly fully, very difficult to get alternate endings. Programed keyboard macros to get through some tough parts. Amazingly, the old 8-bit metroid's graphics were probably better than this game, but this was just so much more interesting and just as much fun. Look forward to other simmilar releases.
This game left me crying in both happiness and horror after digging through all of it's secrets.

Literally one of the finest games available in the metroidvania / exploratory adventure genre.   Everything about this game screams 'NES metroid', but in a new and refreshing way. All the mechanics are handled well, the controls respond smooth and overall the timing in some stages with minute motions is executed flawlessly. No bugs, no errors, no weird glitches, multiple endings, a wide array of authentic and new upgrades and a solid backstory.  The music is superb and really captures the surroundings in a way it feels like it was actually happening. The theatrical elements and overall light forced storytelling really made me want to explore for it, and that's the best possible outcome.  From enemy variety, to puzzle difficulty, to other elements vital in such a game, this one checks them all off.  Overall i rate this game 9.5/10. The only major gripe i had was that there's a minor amount of screen stepping when moving with high speed through some areas. That alone isn't a dealbreaker, it's just not something i personally like. Everything else is solid and i highly advise you to give this one a good try :)  TL:DR. If you're a fan of anything metroid or castlevania or just in the mood for a challenging game, then this is absolutely worth picking up.

This game will run fine on just about any computer, get it if you like old school types of games like i do my self playing them when i was younger worth the $8, and very good pixel art, use a controller its alot easyer!

If you like metroid-style games, you will love this.
great game

Amazing Game. Absolutely recommend to everyone, especially people who loved the 2D Metroid games. The soundtrack and the atmosphere in different locations deserves special praise. Gameplay was also incredibly satisfying.
Well worth full price!
Satisifes your Metroid itch like an ice cold cola satisifes your thirst on a hot summer day.

As a fan of Metroid and Castlevania this is best 2D Metroidvania game I've played. Maybe even better than Metroid itself. Hempuli did an amazing job taking an established formula and tweaking the hell out of it to perfection. The game is loaded with content, filled to the brim with upgrades, hidden areas behind completely normal walls, probably close to 20 bosses.  Just play it. For one guy to make something this good is insane.

This is everything I wanted out of La-Mulana but without the absolute ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t factor tacked on. Gobs of areas to find your way through that are packed with small details, secrets upon secrets around every corner that will have you using a notebook to keep track, multiple endings, and so much more all on top of crisp controls and a fantastic set of tools to work with.

Absolutely amazing game!  Just a forewarning: the bosses can be VERY difficult. If you're like me and you love really hard games, then this will be quite the treat. However, if you don't have much patience with extremely difficult challenging things, PLAY ON EASY MODE. Normal mode can get insanely hard at times, and easy mode gives you a little more breathing room when fighting bosses, because in normal mode, there isn't much room for error.
Awesome game! Best I've played in a long time. Very well-balanced difficulty as the game progresses. Great music. Nice control. Cool bosses. Can't wait 'til the sequel.

This game is probably one of my favorite Steam purchases, hands down. I played it nonstop until I finally beat it. As an adult, that doesn't happen too often anymore, but this game did it for me.  It's an action platformer– lot's have compared it to metroid, I never played metroid but it does remind me of megaman. It's a very challenging game, and I think that's why I love it so much. It's hard, but not in a cheap, game-broken way.   The boss fights are no joke. I had to retry many many times before I beat each one. The platforming can get pretty difficult too; I drove myself crazy trying to get through certain segments, but it got easier with time. The game makes you work hard to excel at it, and when you do, it feels awesome.  Also, there're some hidden power ups near the end that turn the whole game into a cakewalk– if you're willing to go through hell and back to get them.  Last note: the soundtrack is amazing. I never got bored listening to it. So many memorable tunes.

The best metroidvania I have ever played. There's challenging platforming, tough and creative bosses, and a really interesting story that you need to piece together clue by clue. Those things combined with great music and atmosphere make an excellent game that everyone should play.

How did I not write a review for this game yet?  If you loved playing Super Metroid, this is something of a spiritual successor. Obviously, this game is its own thing, but you'd be surprised how much game you'll pull out of this seemingly innocuous title.  Metroidvania fans - get this game.  Be aware, however, that this game is challenging. It's not super hard, but you won't be able to just stumble your way through it. Some skill is required. The game has a nice, smooth learning curve to it, but ultimately you'll just have to git gud. Also, if you're stuck at a boss, it's possible you missed an upgrade somewhere.  EDIT: This game has spoiled me. Every other metroidvania just doesn't quite cut it. I'm looking forward to the sequel!

I really like Metroid and Castlevania games and I really looked forward to Environmental Station Alpha. But sadly the game just continues to confuse and annoy me that I no longer want to complete it anymore. I quit at the part where some enemies were following you on the Y axis in the Volcano area, next to a room with fireball spitting Piranha plants.  =============  Its  good  aspects: - It is aesthetically a nice game, very loyal to the 8-bit graphics I liked with NES games. - It has a nice soundtrack and atmosphere, it really felt like a Metroid inspired game. - The boss battles I did were fun, you may need to learn a pattern, but they were fun to play.  =============  But, its  bad  aspects:  - It is a difficult game, you dont have a lot of health. The enemies and the environment tend to do a lot of damage later in the game. You can crank up your HP by editing the game's config, but I think the ingame upgrades should do this.  - It is a cryptic game, I often did not know what I had to do in order to progress. At first the game helps out with messages on ingame computers, but later on I often had the feeling I was missing certain items in order to progress like a vertical boost jump. I spent a lot of time looking for a fourth energy source in the Temple area, it turned out you had to move through a wall to get to it. I had to look on a YouTube video to figure this one out, that area just looks too much like a plain wall. In Metroid, a Zoomer (enemy) would have crawled along the wall and disappeared inside the hidden part to give a hint. If it were for a secret item like the disks, it would be fine. But not in order to progress in the storyline.  - It is a hard platformer, where you really need to master the hookshot jumps to get where you need to go. Too often I get knocked off by Rinka enemies, falling stalagtites or projectiles and drop into acid or lava. It just becomes annoying after too many times. However, some people may think this is where the challenge of the game is and consider it a good point.  - It is not very rewarding, I think it would have been better if boss battles rewarded you with upgrades rather than having to search for them. Also the heat suit kind of disappointed me, I need it just to get through a few areas. The Metroid Varia suit, deducts damage done from enemies and allows you to walk in lava. Also, killing enemies become a bit of a chore, they do not drop anything usefull like health.  =============  Because of these points I do not recommend this game to other players. Im just a casual gamer however and people with more skill and patience probably will find this game enjoyable. I really wanted to like this game inspired by Metroid, but it just became too difficult and cryptic for me to keep up with it.

This isn't: * Metroid * Metroid II * Super Metroid * Metroid: Zero Mission * Castlevania: Symphony of the Night * Axiom Verge  This is a game with: * Difficult platforming. * Difficult enemies. * Very easy bosses.  Recommended if you pride yourself on completing hard games.
